link.synopsis: Director Ron Howard teams with Steve Martin for a heartwarming comedy about life's most rewarding occupation: parenthood. Gil (Martin) and Karen Buckman (Mary Steenburgen) are facing the age-old dilemma of trying to raise their children the "right" way. But as Gil and the rest of his clan (including Rick Moranis, Tom Hulce, Jason Robards and Dianne Wiest) soon discover, being the "perfect" parent often means just letting children be themselves.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Three Men and a Little Lady
The Outsiders - The Complete Novel Extended Edition

link.synopsis: A surprise hit comedy, American Pie follows four high school friends -- Jim (Jason Biggs), Finch (Eddie Kaye Thomas), Kevin (Thomas Ian Nicholas), and Oz (Chris Klein) -- through their sexually frustrated senior year as they strive for the most eagerly anticipated rite of adulthood: losing one's virginity. This sweet treat offers an affectionate look at a time in our lives when we try to hold onto our dignity -- and end up failing miserably.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion

link.synopsis: Writer-director Francis Veber's clever comedy shadows a group of French intellectuals who gather each Wednesday night for a dinner game, in which the challenge is to bring along the most idiotic guest. Pierre (Thierry Lhermitte) thinks he's found a ringer in François (Jacques Villeret), a civil servant whose passion is making architectural models out of matchsticks. But Pierre gets more than he bargained for when François becomes his houseguest.
link.title: synopsis
He Loves Me, He Loves Me Not
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie

link.synopsis: When office drone Joe (Tom Hanks) learns he has a "brain cloud" and will die soon, he quits his oppressive job and travels to the island of Waponi Woo, whose natives need a human sacrifice to appease their volcano god. On his way there, Joe falls in love with Patricia (Meg Ryan), and the two bravely face their destiny -- and the volcano's inferno -- hand in hand. John Patrick Shanley (Doubt) directs this whimsical, soul-stirring romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Man with One Red Shoe
Dim Sum: A Little Bit of Heart
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family

link.synopsis: In this "reimagining" of the comedy classic, daredevil secret agent and father of the groom Steve Tobias (Michael Douglas) gives conservative podiatrist and father of the bride Jerry Peyser (Albert Brooks) a bad case of prenuptial jitters when they finally meet. The two men, who are soon to be matched as opposite fathers-in-law, become entangled in a secret adventure that takes them to South America just before the big wedding.
link.title: synopsis
A Father ... a Son ... Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control

link.synopsis: One crazy day in the lives of 10 wildly different women -- including a porn star, psychiatrist, flight attendant, housewife, masseuse and others -- forms the basis of this indie comedy from writer-director Sebastian Gutierrez. Starring Carla Gugino as adult film actress Elektra Luxx, the film features an ensemble cast that includes Adrianne Palicki, Connie Britton, Garcelle Beauvais, Emmanuelle Chriqui and Elizabeth Berkley.
link.title: synopsis
The Private Lives of Pippa Lee
The Night of the White Pants
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Disgusted with American society and diagnosed with a brain tumor, Frank teams up with teenager Roxy and the two begin killing reality TV stars, bigots and others they find repugnant in Bobcat Goldthwait's black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: In her Emmy-nominated comedy special for HBO (filmed at the Warner Theater in Washington, D.C.), Wanda Sykes brings her take-no-prisoners comedy style to bear on Barack Obama's presidency, Republican tea parties and the inhuman torture that is bikini waxing. Whether she's sharing true stories about her interracial lesbian marriage or doing hard time as a performer on a gay cruise, Sykes is frequently abrasive -- and fearlessly funny.
link.title: synopsis
I'm the One That I Want
Whoopi: Back on Broadway: The 20th Anniversary
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 1: Best of the Uptown Comics
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
Mo'Nique: I Coulda Been Your Cellmate!
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Suzanne Westenhoefer: A Bottom on Top
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Suzanne Westenhoefer: Live at the Village
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Carlos Mencia: The Best of "Funny Is Funny"
Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Cheech Marin and Friends: Live from South Beach

link.synopsis: Timothy Hines helmed this spirited retelling of William Shakespeare's immortal comedy set in a mystical Athens woodland that's home to, among others, an impish sprite named Puck (Skunk T'weed). When a quartet of querulous paramours comes to the forest, they find that the denizens have romantic troubles, too -- thanks to a spell cast by Puck. The cast includes Maureen Freehill, Bristol Pomeroy and Liza McCarthy.
link.title: synopsis
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

link.synopsis: When bandits kidnap his son, the governor sends his daughter Golden Swallow (Pei-Pei Cheng) to the rescue. With the help of a local beggar known as Drunken Cat (Hua Yueh), Golden Swallow tracks down the main perpetrator, the evil monk Jade Faced Tiger (Hung Lieh Chen). Hailed as a pioneering classic of Hong Kong martial arts cinema, director King Hu's action hit features a butt-kicking turn by the 19-year-old Cheng.
link.title: synopsis
Old Skool Killaz: Daughter of Vengeance
Once Upon a Time in China

link.synopsis: Part of the American Film Theatre series, this adaptation of Eugene O'Neill's play takes place in 1912 at a shady New York bar, where Hickey (Lee Marvin) turns up annually offering free drinks and lively stories to the dismal crowd. This year, Hickey surprises when he arrives sober with a new stance on life. Hoping to liberate the bar's regulars from their meaningless existence, Hickey instead begins questioning his newfound principles.
link.title: synopsis
A Minute to Pray, a Second to Die
All Quiet on the Western Front
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman

link.synopsis: Disney does Dickens in this animated take on &NFi;Oliver Twist&NFi_; that reimagines Oliver (voiced by Joey Lawrence) as an adorable orphaned kitten who struggles to survive in New York City and falls in with a band of canine criminals led by an evil human. First, Oliver meets Dodger (Billy Joel), a carefree mutt with street savoir faire. But when Oliver meets wealthy Jenny (Natalie Gregory) on one of the gang's thieving missions, his life changes forever.
link.title: synopsis
An American Tail: The Treasures of Manhattan Island
An American Tail: Fievel Goes West
The Adventures of Milo and Otis
An American Tail: The Mystery of the Night Monster
Old Yeller / Savage Sam: Double Feature
The Voyages of Young Doctor Dolittle
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
Harry the Dirty Dog...and More Terrific Tails
The Care Bears Movie II: A New Generation
Bark, George ... and More Doggie Tails
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit

link.synopsis: Going way beyond the funny, filmmaker Jordan Brady crafts an eye-opening portrait of the life of a professional comedian, shadowing retired comic Ritch Shydner as he bravely returns to the stand-up stage after more than a decade out of the spotlight. With the aid of candid interviews, backstage footage and performance clips, the film also rounds up advice from many popular comedians on what makes modern audiences laugh.
link.title: synopsis
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Sam Kinison: Why Did We Laugh?
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour

link.synopsis: The Earth's inner core has stopped spinning, and scientist Josh Keyes (Aaron Eckhart) must discover why -- before the world literally falls apart -- by burrowing into the planet's center in a vessel piloted by Maj. Beck Childs (Hilary Swank) and Col. Robert Iverson (Bruce Greenwood). Once there, Keyes and his team of researchers will detonate a device that they hope will get the world to turn again ... before it's too late.
link.title: synopsis
Category 7: The End of the World
Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea

link.synopsis: Set in an alternate reality where the Nazis gain control of London during World War II, this satirical comedy follows a daring young farmworker as he tries to rescue Winston Churchill and vanquish the intimidating German invaders.
link.title: synopsis
Star Wars: Episode III: Revenge of the Sith
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
Battle for the Planet of the Apes
The Men Who Stare at Goats
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: In the midst of a midlife crisis, a psychiatrist forms a relationship with a teenage pot dealer, who trades his product for therapy sessions. Drugs, depression and relationships drive the action in this offbeat indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints
The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys

link.synopsis: College-bound Rachel (Raven-Symoné) finds her tour of prospective schools taking a detour when her overprotective father (Martin Lawrence) insists on coming along. Faced with a string of misadventures, will the pair grow closer together -- or end up killing each other? Flat tires, parachuting and hitching a ride with an alarmingly cheerful motorist (Donny Osmond) are all part of the equation in this uproarious Disney comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Suite Life on Deck: Anchors Away!
Now You See Him, Now You Don't
The Strongest Man in the World
Night at the Museum 2: Battle of the Smithsonian
Fred 2: Night of the Living Fred
Disney Princess Enchanted Tales: Follow Your Dreams
The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again

link.synopsis: The tales of four couples -- and one bold trio -- are explored in candid and hilarious detail in this fresh comedy, which chronicles each relationship over the course of a single sexual encounter. The intertwining stories include two sexually frustrated partners (Kristin Booth and Josh Dean), two not-so-broken-up exes (Sonja Bennett and John Cooke) and two "friends with benefits" (Carly Pope and co-writer Aaron Abrams).
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
The Night of the White Pants
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 2

link.synopsis: Tia and Tamera Mowry ("Sister, Sister") are all grown up in this romantic comedy about a pair of identical twins who try to fall in love via online dating and accidentally start seeing the same dream man.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Laugh to Keep from Crying

link.synopsis: A newscaster who's desperate to keep his job (Art Swenson) attempts to pull his ratings out of the toilet by staging elaborate terrorist news broadcasts. But he unwittingly becomes a headline when he's forced into working alongside real bad guys. William Cheney directs and also co-stars in this independent action farce with a complex plot that involves the KGB, the CIA, the FBI and a haywire North Korean terrorist.
link.title: synopsis
Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild!
Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides
The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
The Scorpion King 2: Rise of a Warrior
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: Mistaken as a member of the distinguished Rothschild family, a shabby bum known as the Guv'nor (George Arliss) utilizes his surprising financial savvy to land an incredible job as a bank manager, upset fellow financiers and exceed absolutely everyone's expectations. This classic comedy co-stars Frank Cellier as Barsac, the retiring bank president who tries to grossly rip off an unsuspecting mining family.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Sherlock Holmes: The Woman in Green

link.synopsis: Hanging out with eccentric pal Pussy Katz (Zooey Deschanel) and a host of oddball customers, slacker Neal Downs (Aaron Stanford) runs a funky bistro in New Orleans that serves nothing but cereal. But his easy life gets difficult when a competitor tries to rip off his restaurant idea. Now, he'll have to fight if he wants to save his lifestyle and his livelihood. Christopher Lloyd co-stars in this quirky indie comedy directed by Michael Lehmann.
link.title: synopsis
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

link.synopsis: In James L. Brooks's Oscar-nominated romantic comedy, three ambitious workaholics are set loose in a network TV newsroom, where their professional and personal lives become hopelessly cross-wired. Anchorman Tom (William Hurt) is smooth, handsome and a bit dumb; Jane (Holly Hunter) is his driven, brilliant producer; and Aaron (Albert Brooks) is a seasoned, uncharismatic reporter who can't stand Tom's instant success on-camera or with Jane.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Looking for Comedy in the Muslim World

link.synopsis: Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton seem to be channeling the legendary dramas of their marriage in this boisterous and bawdy adaptation of William Shakespeare's classic comedy, directed by Franco Zeffirelli. A younger sister cannot wed until her older, shrewish sister Katharina (Taylor) marries first. Petruchio (Burton) is brought in to trick Katharina into wedlock, but the two fall in love despite their passionate bickering.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Shakespeare Comedies: The Taming of the Shrew
Shakespeare Comedies: The Merchant of Venice
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Club-hopping hottie Christina (Cameron Diaz) learns she must temper her voracious wooing approach when she sets her sights on baffled quarry Peter (Thomas Jane) and tracks him to his brother's wedding with her best friends (Christina Applegate and Selma Blair) in tow. But the trio meet a variety of hilarious obstacles on their journey. Roger Kumble directs this raunchy comedy co-starring Parker Posey and Jason Bateman.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

link.synopsis: Fed up with his manipulative girlfriend, Jenny Johnson (Uma Thurman), New Yorker Matt Saunders (Luke Wilson) gives her the heave-ho and moves on with his life, leaving the heartbroken Jenny -- aka G-girl -- to do everything within her superpowers to humiliate Matt. Anna Faris, Rainn Wilson and Eddie Izzard co-star in director Ivan Reitman's slapstick fantasy comedy about a bitter superwoman scorned.
link.title: synopsis
InuYasha: The Movie: Affections Touching Across Time
What's the Worst That Could Happen?

link.synopsis: When he gets wind of his wife's infidelities, control freak Tae Kwon Do instructor Mr. Simmons (Danny McBride) finally loses his cool and sets out on a pilgrimage to see his hero: martial arts master Chuck "The Truck" Wallace (Ben Best). But is the world ready for a meeting between these two over-the-top black-belt egos? Expertly drawn characters and furious action make for a wild ride in this Jody Hill comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 3
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: This quirky Sundance comedy from writer-director Mike Cahill chronicles the journey of a delusional father (Michael Douglas) who's convinced that a fabled treasure is buried somewhere beneath his Southern California suburb. His delinquent daughter (Evan Rachel Wood) -- a high school dropout who was abandoned by her mother and saw her father sent to a mental institution -- resists his ravings at first. But, eventually, she starts to believe.
link.title: synopsis
Jack and Jill vs. the World
Trees Grow Tall and Then They Fall

link.synopsis: Released from prison, French actor-playwright Molière (Romain Duris) learns his freedom was secured by the wealthy but talentless Jourdain (Fabrice Luchini), who wants his help in putting on a play to seduce a comely young widow he fancies. Molière agrees but must pose as a priest to hide his benefactor's secret motives from the household females -- including Jourdain's wife. Laura Morante co-stars in this period comedy set in 17th-century Paris.
link.title: synopsis
The Beat That My Heart Skipped
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: A lifelong loser, coach Lambeau Fields is on the verge of becoming an athletic has-been. When his final shot at victory appears in the form of a deranged crew of college football misfits, Fields steps up to whip the unruly bunch into shape. David Koechner (Anchorman) stars as the hapless coach facing impossible odds in this outrageous spoof of inspirational sports movies from the producers of Wedding Crashers.
link.title: synopsis
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
Major League 3: Back to the Minors

link.synopsis: With 10 children to feed, postwar Ohio housewife Evelyn Ryan (Julianne Moore) has gotten used to being resourceful, stretching her husband's meager salary to the limit. But when clipping coupons won't cut it, she's forced to rely on her creativity. Woody Harrelson and Laura Dern co-star in this uncommon comedy-drama based on a heartwarming memoir by Ryan's daughter, Terry, who recounts her mother's knack for winning contests.
link.title: synopsis
A Love Song for Bobby Long
When Did You Last See Your Father?
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play

title.regular: The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio
title.short: The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio

link.synopsis: Middle-aged lawyer Bertrand (Fabrice Luchini) chafes at the presence of Christophe (Roschdy Zem), a bodyguard assigned to protect him during a dangerous case. Things worsen when Bertrand catches the eye of free-spirited weather girl Audrey (Louise Bourgoin), Christophe's old flame. Audrey brings out long-dormant feelings in the counselor, who finds himself competing against his guardian for her affections in this charming, French-language romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
Don't Let Me Die on a Sunday
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: When the mob decides to call in a favor, factory exec Antonio Badalamenti (Alberto Sordi) finds himself in the unlikely role of Mafia assassin in this Golden Globe-nominated crime drama that deftly walks the line between comedy and tragedy. Tapped by a Sicilian don to perform a hit in New York, the inexperienced Antonio must somehow carry out his mission, all the while keeping his criminal connections hidden from his unsuspecting family.
link.title: synopsis
The Night of the Shooting Stars
Blood Vows: The Story of a Mafia Wife

link.synopsis: Frontiersmen Kit Carson and "Buffalo" Bill Cody braved America's Western territories, forging a path for others and leaving behind a legacy of Wild West legends. Covering Carson's role in the conquest of California, Cody's early days as a buffalo hunter and life on the road with Buffalo Bill's traveling show, this program tracks the lives of these bold adventurer-soldiers through artifacts and interviews with historians and other experts.
link.title: synopsis
Journey to Oblivion: The Empress of Ireland Story
The Best and Worst of Tred Barta
Blood and Oil: The Middle East in World War I
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
Time Machine: When Cowboys Were King
Sacagawea: Heroine of the Lewis and Clark Journey
Rameses: Wrath of God or Man?
Empires: Peter and Paul and the Christian Revolution
Thomas Jefferson: A View from the Mountain
Investigating History: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
Project XX: End of the Trail
The True Story of Alexander the Great
History's Mysteries: The True Story of Marco Polo
Da Vinci and the Code He Lived By
National Geographic: Beyond the Movie: Alexander the Great
Tales of the Gun: Guns of Smith & Wesson

title.regular: Carson and Cody: The Hunter Heroes
title.short: Carson and Cody: The Hunter Heroes

link.synopsis: When Rachel Phelps (Margaret Whitton) inherits the Cleveland Indians from her deceased husband, she's determined to move the team to a warmer climate -- but only a losing season will make that possible, which should be easy given the misfits she's hired. Rachel is sure her dream will come true, but she underestimates their will to succeed! Tom Berenger, Charlie Sheen, Corbin Bernsen and Rene Russo star in this surprise hit baseball comedy.
link.title: synopsis
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: Privileged Chihuahua Chloe (voiced by Drew Barrymore) rides in style in her owner's designer handbag -- until the pampered pooch gets lost during a Mexican vacation and must find her way home with help from some newfound canine friends. Salma Hayek, George Lopez, Edward James Olmos, Cheech Marin and Andy Garcia also lend their voices to the cast of this whimsical live-action comedy directed by Raja Gosnell.
link.title: synopsis
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
Adventures of Bailey: The Lost Puppy
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
Scooby-Doo and the Legend of the Vampire

link.synopsis: Jim Henson's inspired 1970s comedy series stars Kermit the Frog as an eternally put-upon stage manager tyring to keep order behind the scenes at a vaudeville-style musical stage revue starring Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and other beloved Muppets. Between running gags (Miss Piggy's affection for "Kermie"), recurring sketches ("Pigs in Space") and other mayhem, Kermit and company host guest celebrities such as John Denver, Bob Hope and Carol Burnett.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of The Electric Company: Vol. 2
Sesame Street: 40 Years of Sunny Days
The Best of The Electric Company
Sesame Street: 20 Years ... and Still Counting
Care Bears: King of the Moon
SpongeBob SquarePants: Nautical Nonsense & Sponge Buddies

Clifford's Puppy Days: Practice Makes Perfect
Clifford the Big Red Dog: A Big Help
Clifford: Everyone Loves Clifford / Good Times, Good Friends
Franklin and the Green Knight: The Movie
Clifford: Big Fun in the Sun
Clifford's Puppy Days: New Friends, Little Puppy, Big Adventures
Clifford's Puppy Days: Puppy Sports Spectacular

link.synopsis: John Pinette has been cracking up audiences around the world for more than 15 years. He was named Stand-Up Comedian of the Year by the American Comedy Awards in 1999 and has received a Gemini Award nomination for his superb televised performance at The Montreal Comedy Festival in 2000. This video was recorded at the Tempe, Ariz., Improv in 2004 and includes the bonus feature "You Go Now" (Pinette's 1992 appearance on Fox's "Sunday Comics").
link.title: synopsis
Ralphie May: Girth of a Nation
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Richard Jeni: A Big Steaming Pile of Me
Rita Rudner: Live from Las Vegas
Billy Connolly: Live in New York
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Lewis Black: Red, White and Screwed
Craig Shoemaker: Live: That's a True Story!
Denis Leary: The Complete Denis Leary
Pablo Francisco: Ouch! Live from San Jose
National Lampoon Live: New Faces: Vol. 1
National Lampoon Live: New Faces: Vol. 2
National Lampoon Live: The International Show
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
Comedy Jump Off: The Latino Connection
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
The Original Latin Kings of Comedy
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden

title.regular: John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
title.short: John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay

link.synopsis: In director Woody Allen's Golden Globe-nominated musical comedy of intertwining stories, Steffi (Goldie Hawn) marries Bob (Alan Alda) after her divorce from Joe (Woody Allen), whose attempt to win the heart of Von (Julia Roberts) takes him to Europe. This is all told through the eyes of narrator DJ (Natasha Lyonne), Joe and Steffi's daughter, who's dealing with her own family issues as new stepsister Skylar's (Drew Barrymore) wedding is postponed.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: After congenital loser David (Matt Dillon) is fired from his high-paying bank job and his beautiful fiancée (Christina Applegate) calls off their wedding on the same miserable day, his luck impossibly goes from bad to worse when he inadvertently becomes involved in a robbery. Steve Zahn takes a show-stealing turn as David's ne'er-do-well best friend in this entertaining dark comedy from director Mitch Rouse.
link.title: synopsis
The 2005 Academy Award Short Films Collection

link.synopsis: Director Kenneth Branagh shifts Shakespeare's tale of love and mistaken identity to a British enclave in feudal Japan, where beautiful Rosalind (Bryce Dallas Howard) dresses as a man when she's banished to the forest, but learns her beloved Orlando (David Oyelowo) can't recognize her. Complete with sumo wrestlers and ninjas, Branagh's adaptation of the Bard's classic comedy also boasts a star-studded cast, including Kevin Kline and Alfred Molina.
link.title: synopsis
Shakespeare Comedies: As You Like It
The Loss of a Teardrop Diamond

link.synopsis: When Robert "Fish" Fishman (Rainn Wilson), a washed-up drummer from a 1980s supergroup, reluctantly accepts a gig on the skins in his nephew's high school band, he discovers that his dreams of rock 'n' roll stardom haven't completely died. Can he take his new band, A.D.D., all the way to the top? Christina Applegate, Josh Gad, Jane Lynch and Emma Stone co-star in this lighthearted comedy from director Peter Cattaneo.
link.title: synopsis
Thin Lizzy the Rocker: A Portrait of Philip Lynottt
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
Married... with Children: The Most Outrageous Episodes: Vol. 2

link.synopsis: Panic erupts when a package of cocaine is inadvertently delivered to the wrong address by a hapless delivery driver in this dark comedy. As the sender tries to retrieve the drugs, the unintentional recipients plan to sell their unexpected bounty. Meanwhile, the crooks who were supposed to receive the contraband shipment find themselves in a major bind. Donald Faison, Mos Def, Mike Epps, Lauren London and Debbie Allen star.
link.title: synopsis
Journey to the End of the Night
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Mike Epps Presents: Live from Club Nokia

link.synopsis: Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Steve-O, Chris Pontius, Ryan Dunn, Preston Lacy, Jason Acua, Ehren McGhehey and Dave England continue to make asses of themselves and others in these recently unearthed episodes of the insane cable comedy series. Poor taste and deplorable antics are front and center in classic "Jackass" episodes like "Stun Collar," "Unicycle Poo Barf," "Fast Food Football" and more.
link.title: synopsis
Jackass Presents: Mat Hoffman's Tribute to Evel Knievel
Bam Margera Presents: Where the #$&% is Santa?
Steve-O: The Dumbest Asshole in Hip Hop
CKY: Infiltrate, Destroy, Rebuild: The Video Album
Travis and the Nitro Circus: Vol. 2
Travis and the Nitro Circus: Vol. 3
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat
Spike and Mike's Sick & Twisted Festival of Animation: Full Frontal

link.synopsis: Based on the hit children's book, this comedy follows misfit Greg Heffley and his pal Rowley Jefferson as their summer vacation disintegrates into one wild misadventure after another, including a disastrous attempt to start a lawn-mowing business.
link.title: synopsis
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Squeakquel
Wizards on Deck with Hannah Montana
Sigmund and the Sea Monsters: Season 1
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie
VeggieTales: Duke and the Great Pie War
Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs

title.regular: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days
title.short: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days

link.synopsis: While two researchers are competing for a grant, one must deal with a strange woman who's devoted her life to confusing and embarrassing him. Meanwhile, a woman's jewels are stolen and a government whistleblower arrives with top-secret papers. All, of course, have the same style overnight bag. Barbra Streisand, Ryan O'Neal and Madeline Kahn star in this homage to classic screwball comedies from director Peter Bogdanovich.
link.title: synopsis
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
Barbra Streisand: The Television Specials: My Name Is Barbra
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
The Return of the Pink Panther

link.synopsis: After losing his girlfriend, Pete (Mark Lyons) tries to win her back by crashing a big party with his fellow high school pals. But when the bash gets busted by the cops, the boys get separated and find themselves on the run from the law. Now our inebriated heroes must stay one step ahead of the police as they scramble to find each other -- and the next party -- in this low-budget screwball comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Rosanna Arquette stars as Cassie, a waitress who graduated from the school of hard knocks. After surviving a horrible relationship and giving her baby up for adoption, she's gun-shy about trusting anyone -- until she meets a stagehand named Riley (Eric Roberts). He seems to be a good catch, but will Cassie's doubts cause her to miss her one chance at happiness? Pulitzer Prize winner Beth Henley penned the screenplay for this genial romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon
I Love You, I Love You Not

link.synopsis: Set in rural France at the time of the Crusades, Rossini's last comic opera is the saucy tale of Le Comte Ory and his pursuit of the crusaders' wives who chastely await the return of their menfolk. Andrew Davis conducts the London Philharmonic Orchestra in this acclaimed production recorded at Glyndebourne with the talents of French soprano Annick Masis as Adele, Belgian tenor Marc Laho as Comte Ory and Diana Montague as Isolier.
link.title: synopsis
Tchaikovsky: Eugene Onegin: The Metropolitan Opera
Luciano Pavarotti: Verdi: Un Ballo in Maschera
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
The Promise of Music: Gustavo Dudamel
The Opera Gala: Live from Baden-Baden
Georges Bizet: Les Pecheurs De Perles
Cook, Dixon & Young: In Concert: Vol. 1
Natalie Dessay: Greatest Moments on Stage
Henze: L'Upupa Und Der Triumph Der Sohnesliebe
Reopening Gala of the Teatro La Fenice
Renee Fleming and Bryn Terfel: Under the Stars
Bravo Domingo: The Best of Placido Domingo
Maria Callas: Living and Dying for Art and Love

link.synopsis: Mistakenly posted to a far-flung Greenland base in 1979, Cpl. Rudy Spruance (Jason Biggs) is tasked with starting a camp newsletter. After adjusting to his new role, Rudy happens upon an infirmary full of mutilated soldiers -- and an elaborate government scheme to cover up the repercussions of a disastrous mission in Vietnam. Natascha McElhone, Jeremy Northam and Michael Ironside also star in director Saul Metzstein's inky comedy.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand

link.synopsis: Widower Bob Holcomb (Bob Hope) is forced to think twice after he tries to keep his teenage daughter, JoJo (Tuesday Weld), from marrying "good for nothing" Kenny (Frankie Avalon) in this romantic comedy. Things go well when Bob takes a job in Sweden and Jojo is away from Kenny. But when she falls for a notorious Swedish playboy (Jeremy Slate), Bob devises a plan to get Jojo and Kenny -- who's not so bad after all -- back together.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: In this good-natured fish-out-of-water comedy, disenchanted Texas oil tycoon Felix Happer (Burt Lancaster) sets out to buy an entire Scottish town in order to drill offshore. When one curmudgeon stands in his way -- he refuses to sell his precious beach -- Happer calls off his negotiating dogs and visits the town himself to finish the deal. Of course, it's not long before the quirky, small-town vibe works its magic on this cynical outsider.
link.title: synopsis
The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore
The Man in the White Suit
The Ealing Comedy Collection: The Maggie
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
The Man Who Would Be King

link.synopsis: When his treasured bicycle is stolen, Pee-Wee Herman (Paul Reubens) is devastated -- and he'll do anything to get it back. Working off a hot tip that his wheels may be stashed in the Alamo's basement, Pee-Wee sets off on a whirlwind cross-country adventure. Quirky filmmaker Tim Burton directs this classic comedy co-written by Reubens, Phil Hartman and Michael Varhol. Elizabeth Daily co-stars as Pee-Wee's girlfriend.
link.title: synopsis
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition
Back to the Future Part III
Back to the Future Part II
Three Men and a Little Lady
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country

link.synopsis: Cary Grant, captain of the &NFi;Sea Tiger&NFi_; submarine, faces a multitude of hurdles to World War II battle -- severe damage to his vessel, countless supply problems and a conniving supply officer (Tony Curtis) whose combat inexperience is apparent. The plot dives deeper when five Army nurses board the all-male ship and further rock the boat in this lively comedy, which was nominated for a Best Screenplay Oscar. Dina Merrill co-stars.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
I Was a Male War Bride
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
The Last Time I Saw Archie
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming

link.synopsis: In this comedy based on real events, a small sheepherding village in Australia is thrust into the spotlight when NASA employs its massive satellite radio dish to serve as a backup transmitter for the 1969 Apollo 11 moon mission. But when a change in the spacecraft's schedule puts the primary dish out of range, it's up to the Aussies to ensure that the history-making mission is broadcast to the masses. Sam Neill and Patrick Warburton star.
link.title: synopsis
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
In the Shadow of the Moon
Magnificent Desolation: Walking on the Moon
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio

link.synopsis: In this critically panned but popular comedy, superstore warehouse workers Vince (Dax Shepard) and Zack (Dane Cook) compete in a full-on war to be named Employee of the Month and get a date with their collective dream girl, Amy (Jessica Simpson), a sexy new cashier. When Amy announces she likes ambitious men, the two slackers turn into Super Club superstars and go head-to-head in a brutal competition to impress her.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People

link.synopsis: John Leguizmo and Alfred Molina head up an all-star cast in this multicultural ensemble comedy that follows a trio of Puerto Rican siblings -- a Marine, an actress and a businessman -- on their way home to Chicago for a Christmastime family reunion. Directed by Alfredo De Villa, the holiday tale also features performances by Debra Messing, Luis Guzman, Jay Hernandez, Freddy Rodriguez, Vanessa Ferlito and Melonie Diaz.
link.title: synopsis
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play
Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood
Diary of a Mad Black Woman

link.synopsis: Filmed in his native New Zealand, this comedy from writer-director Taika Waititi (Eagle vs. Shark) follows 11-year-old Boy and his younger brother, Rocky, whose rich fantasy lives are stopped cold when their father returns home after years away. Although Boy has imagined that his father (Waititi) is a dashing, accomplished hero who is related to Michael Jackson, in reality he is a failed gangster seeking to restore his family's faith in him.
link.title: synopsis
Before the Devil Knows You're Dead
Precious: Based on the Novel Push by Sapphire
Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call New Orleans

link.synopsis: High-flying comedy duo Cheech Marin and Tommy Chong reunite for their long-anticipated Light Up America tour, stopping off in San Antonio, Texas, to entertain an enthusiastic bunch of stoners at the city's Majestic Theatre. The weed-worshipping pair frequently interrupts their San Antonio stand-up antics to bring you classic bits from the 1970s and '80s, plus new sketches featuring Chong's wife, Shelby.
link.title: synopsis
Cheech Marin and Friends: Live from South Beach
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
The Original Latin Kings of Comedy
Jamie Foxx: I Might Need Security
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded

link.synopsis: UPN sitcom star, stand-up comedienne, author, model and designer Mo'Nique is an original -- and the first female host of the historic late night variety show "It's Showtime at the Apollo!" Showcased is a collection of this comedy diva's stand-up appearances, including HBO's "Def Comedy Jam," "Apollo Comedy Hour," HBO's "Snaps," BET's "Comic View," The Montreal Comedy Festival and Uptown Comedy Club.
link.title: synopsis
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Mo'Nique: I Coulda Been Your Cellmate!
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 2
Best of Platinum Comedy Series: Vol. 1
Platinum Comedy Series: Sheryl Underwood: Too Much Information
Platinum Comedy Series: The Good, The Badd, The Funny
Platinum Comedy Series: Bruce Bruce: Live
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Cedric the Entertainer: Taking You Higher
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
We Don't Die, We Multiply: The Robin Harris Story
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from Dallas
Alonzo Bodden: Tall, Dark and Funny
Rerun's In The Hood / Rerun's Comedy Jam

link.synopsis: Starting this coming-of-age documentary in her own hometown, filmmaker Heather Courtney follows a tight-knit group of friends who grow up together, sign up for the National Guard and are subsequently sent to Afghanistan.
link.title: synopsis
Blessed Is the Match: The Life and Death of Hannah Senesh
Return to Tarawa: The Leon Cooper Story
Into the Arms of Strangers: Stories of the Kindertransport
Bedford: The Town They Left Behind
Hiroshima: BBC History of World War II
National Geographic: Arlington: Field of Honor
Lawrence of Arabia: The Battle for the Arab World
Fate Did Not Let Me Go
Brother Outsider: The Life of Bayard Rustin
4192: The Crowning of the Hit King
Visual Acoustics: The Modernism of Julius Shulman

link.synopsis: Fresh out of high school and determined to do something with his life, Danny (Daniel Jordano) recruits his friends Spikes (Matthew Penn) and Silk (Leon W. Grant) to help him open a rock 'n' roll hotel that never sleeps, offering live entertainment 24-7. But the locals aren't exactly thrilled with the idea of having such noisy new neighbors. Marisa Tomei co-stars in this music-driven teen comedy written and directed by Harvey and Bob Weinstein.
link.title: synopsis
Girls Just Want to Have Fun
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Paris's seedy underworld is the setting for this pair of films starring Brigitte Bardot. In the comedy Naughty Girl, Bardot plays the precocious daughter of a nightclub owner who, when suspected of counterfeiting, flees the city and entrusts her safety to a playboy lounge singer. In the crime drama Come Dance with Me, the wife (Bardot) of a suspected murderer goes undercover as a dance instructor to clear her husband's name.
link.title: synopsis
Don Juan (Or If Don Juan Were a Woman)
Untamable Angélique / Angélique and the Sultan
How Much Do You Love Me?
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

title.regular: Naughty Girl / Come Dance with Me
title.short: Naughty Girl / Come Dance with Me

link.synopsis: Comedy greats George Carlin, Richard Pryor, Bill Cosby, Lily Tomlin, Andy Kaufman, Steve Martin and other performers who came into their own in the 1960s and '70s take the stage in this collection of rare vintage performances. The turbulent era ushered in a new style of stand-up, and it's no joke that many of the stars in this collection paved the way for Chris Rock, Sacha Baron Cohen, Kathy Griffin and others.
link.title: synopsis
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 3: Launching Pad
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 3
Make 'Em Laugh: The Funny Business of America
George Carlin: Playing with Your Head
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York
This Land Is Your Land: The Folk Years
George Carlin: You are All Diseased
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings
Gidget Goes Hawaiian / Gidget Goes to Rome
The Wrong Arm of the Law
How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?
The Three Stooges: Stop, Look and Laugh
George Carlin: On Location With George Carlin

link.synopsis: This epic tale of love and loss follows a wounded Civil War soldier making a long, treacherous journey home. All the while, his faraway love fights for her own sanity and survival on her deceased father's farm.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture

link.title: Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War
Born on the Fourth of July

link.synopsis: An inept group of small-time hoods has just six hours to carry out a hit for the local crime boss. But there's one major problem: The group's target -- an elusive mobster named Carmine Dellarosa -- doesn't seem to exist. Will the hoods be able to scare up a body before 5 p.m.? Joe Mantegna, Kevin Pollak, Joe Pantoliano and Jennifer Tilly co-star in this screwball comedy of errors written and directed by indie filmmaker Mark Malone.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Days of Frankie the Fly

link.synopsis: Martial-arts megastar Jackie Chan writes, directs and stars in this action-comedy. Secret agent Jackie (Chan) leads a commando group to Africa to kidnap scientists who are working to unleash a powerful -- and lethal -- new energy source. When Jackie develops amnesia after a plane crash, he fights to regain his memory and continue his assignment. Who Am I is packed with excitement and, of course, Jackie's unique brand of gymnastic martial arts.
link.title: synopsis
Operation Condor 2: Armour of the Gods
Jackie Chan: The Kung Fu Years / Force 5 / The Power of Aikido / Dr. Wai
Once Upon a Time in China 2
Once Upon a Time in China 3
Detective Dee and the Mystery of the Phantom Flame

link.synopsis: Talented Brazilian funnyman Rafinha Bastos doles out 60 minutes of rib-tickling comedy -- and stirs up plenty of controversy -- in this blunt, uncensored and no-holds-barred performance.
link.title: synopsis
Russell Peters: The Green Card Tour
How Tasty Was My Little Frenchman
Patrice O'Neal: Elephant in the Room
Once Upon a Time in Rio
Blood and Wine: A Brazilian Story
Love for Sale: Suely in the Sky
To the Left of the Father
The Year My Parents Went on Vacation
The Other Side of the Street

link.synopsis: Detective Jack Cates (Nick Nolte) is forced to do the unbearable in order to catch a pair of escaped cop killers: He temporarily paroles wisecracking hustler Reggie Hammond (Eddie Murphy) into his custody. The dilemma: This odd couple has only 48 hours to solve the crime before Reggie has to go back to the slammer. Murphy's Golden Globe-nominated performance in this buddy-cop comedy helped put his career on a trajectory to superstardom.
link.title: synopsis
Down and Out in Beverly Hills
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
Live Like a Cop, Die Like a Man
To Live and Die in L.A.

link.synopsis: Wealthy American diplomat Philip (Cary Grant) and famous actress Anne (Ingrid Bergman) meet just as Anne has decided that all the best men in the world are taken. Although Philip is indeed married, Anne can't resist their instant attraction and electricity, and they begin a passionate affair. But an unexpected secret Philip hides from his new love threatens to spoil everything. Stanley Donen directed this sparkling romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Successful attorney Amanda Bonner (Katharine Hepburn) decides to defend Doris (Judy Holliday), who stands accused of the attempted murder of her husband (Tom Ewell) and his mistress (Jean Hagen), while Bonner's lawyer husband, Adam (Spencer Tracy), signs on as the prosecuting attorney. The sensational trial that ensues finds them sitting at opposing sides of the courtroom -- and the dinner table. George Cukor directs this Oscar-nominated comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Robin Williams stars in this Barry Levinson comedy as the irreverent host of a political satire talk show who decides to run for president. But his stunt to expose Washington corruption goes further than he expects when he actually wins the election. Meanwhile, a software engineer (Laura Linney) suspects that a computer glitch is responsible for his surprising victory … but will she speak up? Jeff Goldblum and Christopher Walken co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Brady Bunch in the White House
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
The City of Your Final Destination

link.synopsis: When his girlfriend, Jane (Jennifer Westfeldt), refuses to marry him because her first marriage was such a disaster, George (David Sutcliffe) finds himself propelled back in time 10 years, where he has a chance to prevent Jane from taking that fateful trip down the aisle. But now, George must find a way to win Jane's heart from the man she thinks she'll love and cherish forever. Lauren Holly co-stars in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
He's Just Not That Into You
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: This Woody Allen comedy interweaves four dramatic tales set in Rome -- in one of which Allen plays a dad meeting his daughter's Italian in-laws to-be. Other cast members include Roberto Begnini as a man mistaken for a film star.
link.title: synopsis
R2: Y el Caso del Cadaver Sin Cabeza
The Other Side of the Bed
El Penalti Mas Largo Del Mundo

link.synopsis: Stunning photography of some of the world's most spectacular butterflies elevates this polished educational documentary that includes fascinating footage of the lifecycle changes and behaviors of these delicate winged wonders. Featuring segments on morphology, physiology and reproduction as well as a how-to section on creating butterfly-friendly gardens, the film offers a wealth of knowledge for butterfly lovers.
link.title: synopsis
American Wonders: National Parks of the West
The Natural History of the Chicken
John James Audubon: Drawn From Nature
Death by Design: The Life and Times of Life and Times
National Geographic: Gabon: The Last Eden
National Geographic: 30 Years of National Geographic Specials
A Paralyzing Fear: The Story of Polio in America
National Geographic: Eden at the End of the World
National Geographic: Big Sur: Wild California
American Experience: Into the Deep: America, Whaling & the World
America's Castles: The Homes of Frank Lloyd Wright
Food Beware: The French Organic Revolution

title.regular: In the Company of Wild Butterflies
title.short: In the Company of Wild Butterflies

link.synopsis: In this unconventional comedy, writer-director Gerardo Olivares tracks the individual journeys of three far-flung groups of soccer fans: a tribe of Amazonian indios, a family of Mongolian nomads and a caravan of Tuareg people in the Sahara Desert. Overcome with a desire to watch the 2002 World Cup between Brazil and Germany play out on television, these unlikely soccer buffs make a 500-kilometer trek to find a town with a working TV set.
link.title: synopsis
Stranded: I've Come from a Plane That Crashed on the Mountains
Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: Veteran of the stand-up comedy road Greg Giraldo may not be a household name, but you'll see why he should be as he unloads his latest misanthropic, righteous, heated and very funny rants in this Comedy Central special. Best known for his appearances on countless Comedy Central Roasts, Giraldo is an unparalleled comic's comic with a rough exterior and a soft, bleeding heart whose years of practice have honed a scathing, razor-sharp wit.
link.title: synopsis
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Roast of Bob Saget: Uncensored Extended
Lewis Black's Root of All Evil
Comedy Central Salutes George W. Bush
Artie Lange: It's the Whiskey Talkin'
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
An Evening with Kevin Smith 2: Evening Harder
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy

link.synopsis: Just released from jail, father-and-son crooks Karl (Robin Hill) and Bill (Robert Hill) attempt to keep their two-bit illegal enterprise from crumbling while ferreting out the snitch who squealed on them to the cops in this British black comedy. The suspects include Karl's wife (Julia Deakin) and pregnant gal pal (Kerry Peacock), a hit man (Michael Smiley) and a reviled family friend (Tony Way). As the double crosses multiply, so do the laughs.
link.title: synopsis
A Film with Me in It
Across the Line: The Exodus of Charlie Wright

link.synopsis: When patrons at a local watering hole (including Balthazar Getty, Judah Friedlander and Eileen Ryan) are attacked by a swarm of flying gargoyle-like beasts, they're forced to work together to fight for survival in this gory horror-comedy, the product of the third season of the "Project Greenlight" series. Together they board up the windows -- the phone, however, is shot, and there is little hope as the carnage continues to mount.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Middle-aged professor Rose Morgan (Barbra Streisand) is tired of being single and living with her mother (Lauren Bacall). Thus, when a colleague (Jeff Bridges), proposes, Morgan accepts. But Morgan's colleague is in love with her mind, and the marriage he proposed is a platonic one. Not surprisingly, more discontentment follows. Streisand directed this romantic comedy, which earned a Golden Globe for Bacall and an Oscar nomination for Best Song.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture

link.title: Barbra Streisand: The Television Specials: Color Me Barbra
Barbra Streisand: Timeless: Live in Concert
He's Just Not That Into You

link.synopsis: Nat "King" Cole and Stubby Kaye provide a Greek chorus-style narrative in this tongue-in-cheek Western parody that's become a classic in its own right. In director Elliot Silverstein's Oscar-winning comedy, Cat's (Jane Fonda) father has been murdered by a gunslinger (Lee Marvin), and now, the schoolmarm-cum-outlaw must team with boozehound Kid Shelleen (also played by Marvin) to prevent her father's ranch from falling into the wrong hands.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
A Big Hand for the Little Lady
Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick

link.synopsis: Krzysztof Kieslowski's dark comedy -- the middle segment in his "three colors" trilogy -- shadows Polish immigrant Karol Karol (Zbigniew Zamachowski) as he's humiliated in a public courtroom by his wife (Julie Delpy) during their divorce proceedings. Shamed and brokenhearted, he finds an ally in a fellow countryman, and the two eventually concoct a way back to post-Communist Poland, where Karol sets about rebuilding his life.
link.title: synopsis
Jean de Florette / Manon of the Spring
Les Dames du Bois de Boulogne
He Loves Me, He Loves Me Not

link.synopsis: After a lightning bolt zaps a robot named Number 5, the lovable machine starts to think he's human and escapes the lab. Hot on his trail is his designer, Newton (Steve Guttenberg), who hopes to get to Number 5 before the military does. In the meantime, a spunky animal lover (Ally Sheedy) mistakes the robot for an alien and takes him in, teaching her new guest about life on Earth. This high-tech comedy adventure hit spawned a 1988 sequel.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition
Back to the Future Part III
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings

link.synopsis: Divorced yuppie Kate (Brooke Shields) gathers her non-single gal pals for a relaxing weekend in Palm Springs, where the female bonding and significant-other kvetching soon give way to infidelity with five male strangers. While the girls enjoy their lost weekend, questions arise over what they'll tell their fellas back home in this witty ensemble comedy-drama, which also stars Virginia Madsen, D.B. Sweeney, Dan Cortese and Johnathon Schaech.
link.title: synopsis
Love in the Time of Money
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!
Girls Just Want to Have Fun

link.synopsis: Michael Crichton's second feature film follows Dr. Susan Wheeler (Geneviève Bujold), a resident whose best friend winds up on life support after undergoing a routine procedure. When Susan investigates, she discovers that her friend's death wasn't an isolated incident. Susan airs her concerns to her boyfriend, Dr. Mark Bellows (Michael Douglas), but he doesn't want her suspicions interfering with his quest to become chief resident.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Knew Too Much

link.synopsis: Two young Chinese mainlanders transplanted to Hong Kong -- naive Xiao-Jun Li (Leon Lai) and street-smart Qiao Li (Maggie Cheung) -- become fast friends and then try not to fall in love despite their deepening feelings for each other. Though the duo spends all their free time together, will the arrival of Xiao-Jun's girlfriend tear them apart forever? Irene Tsu also stars in this bittersweet drama directed by Peter Chan.
link.title: synopsis
Over the Rainbow, Under the Skirt

link.synopsis: This historical saga spotlights the Tolpuddle Martyrs, a band of British farm laborers whose protests marked a first step in forming trade unions. The courage of the movement and the fate that befell them are portrayed with sympathy and objectivity.
link.title: synopsis
Lois Gibbs and the Love Canal
Born on the Fourth of July
The Road to Freedom: The Vernon Johns Story
Teamster Boss: The Jackie Presser Story

link.synopsis: When unrepentant philanderer Hirsch crosses the line one too many times, his latest squeeze Jessica hits on a plan to teach her man that what's good for the goose is good for the gander. But will Hirsch see the error of his ways and change the course of his life, or will he treat Jessica like just another notch on his bedpost and move along to his next conquest? Brian Grey stars in this outlandish romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
He Say, She Say, But What Does God Say?
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
Tyler Perry: What's Done in the Dark
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: In this pitch-black comedy, recent college grad Heck Prigusivac (Jonathan Tucker) takes a job as executioner at the same prison where his estranged brother Chick (Jeremy Renner) resides on death row. Family bonds put a strain on the young executioner, and life gets even more complicated when Heck falls in love with another death row inmate -- his brother's ex-girlfriend (Ginnifer Goodwin). Christine Ebersole and Michael Fairman co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Heart Is Deceitful Above All Things
A Nightmare Come True / Two Came Back
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Before the Devil Knows You're Dead

link.synopsis: When his girlfriend gets sent to an all-female Catholic boarding school, sex-crazed teenager Jerry (Richard Gabai) calls upon his bungling buddies to help him break into the tightly guarded campus and rescue his lady love. Co-starring Burt Ward as the damsel in distress's father and Linnea Quigley as her nasty nemesis, this wacky sex comedy features ridiculous disguises, phony orgasms and, of course, gratuitous nudity.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: One of Alec Guinness's strangest British comedies, this Oscar-nominated film is well worth your time. An eccentric artist, just recently released from jail, somehow convinces rich "clients" to pay him for artwork they didn't order. A curious mixture of the usual British brand of subtle comedy with a pinch of black comedy thrown in, the film earned Guinness an Oscar nomination for Best Adapted Screenplay.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
The Bridge on the River Kwai

link.synopsis: Aboard the cruise ship SS Happy Wanderer, Capt. Crowther (Sid James) grows increasingly miserable as last-minute replacements to his crew, including the cook (Lance Percival), doctor (Kenneth Connor) and first officer (Kenneth Williams), prove to be absolutely useless. In this nautical installment of the Carry On comedy franchise, gal pals Glad (Liz Fraser) and Florence (Dilys Laye) develop a fierce rivalry as they compete for the same man.
link.title: synopsis
Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
The Last Time I Saw Archie
The Return of the Pink Panther
The Knack...and How to Get It
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium

link.synopsis: High school misfits Stoney (Pauly Shore) and Dave (Sean Astin) discover a long-frozen primeval man from the past in their back yard. But the thawed-out Link (Brendan Fraser), as the boys have named him, quickly becomes a wild card in the teens' already zany Southern California lives. After a shave and some new clothes, Link's presence at school makes the daily drudgery a lot more interesting in director Les Mayfield's fish-out-of-water comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Pauly Shore's Natural Born Komics Sketch Comedy Movie: Miami
Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: Sarah Jessica Parker, Bette Midler and Kathy Najimy star in this supernatural family comedy as a trio of 17th-century sibling witches who are accidentally resurrected in the 20th century by teenager Max.
link.title: synopsis
It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown
The Haunted Pumpkin of Sleepy Hollow
Scooby-Doo and the Legend of the Vampire
Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

link.synopsis: Akira Kurosawa's sequel to Yojimbo is a dark comedy about surly Sanjuro (Toshirô Mifune), a larger-than-life samurai who, adrift in an era of fading tradition and increasing lawlessness, instructs a gang of scheming radicals in samurai wisdom. An unlikely hero who loves an action-packed swordfight and is quick with the sarcasm, Sanjuro doesn't always practice what he preaches, but he always remains true to himself.
link.title: synopsis
I Live in Fear: Record of a Living Being
Samurai Trilogy 3: Duel at Ganryu Island
Samurai Trilogy 2: Duel at Ichijoji Temple
Zatoichi: Vol. 2: The Tale of Zatoichi Continues
Zatoichi: Vol. 11: Zatoichi and the Doomed Man
Bushido: The Cruel Code of the Samurai

link.synopsis: Lawyer Fletcher Reede's (Jim Carrey) mendacious ways destroyed his marriage and alienated his son, Max (Justin Cooper). But when Max makes a birthday wish that magically comes true, Fletcher finds himself incapable of telling a lie for 24 hours. That's great news for Max and his mom (Maura Tierney), but terrible timing for Fletcher, who's due in court to try a major divorce case. Carrey earned a Golden Globe nod for his role in this broad comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
The 2006 Academy Award Short Films Collection

link.synopsis: While visiting London in 1911 to attend the crowning of King George V, a stuffy Carpathian nobleman (Laurence Olivier) surprisingly finds himself attracted to saucy American showgirl Elsie Marina (Marilyn Monroe) in this bright romantic comedy. But complications and political intrigue ensue as a plot to topple the Balkan throne comes to light. Sybil Thorndike shines as the off-her-trolley queen dowager.
link.title: synopsis
There's No Business Like Show Business

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, Gwyneth Paltrow stars as Donna, a suburban California girl with big dreams. All Donna wants is to become a flight attendant and see the world, and she learns the trade from veteran Sally (Candice Bergen). Diana's journey turbulence when she encounters a catty colleague (Christina Applegate), a frisky pilot (Rob Lowe) and a crazy instructor (Mike Myers). But Donna's "experienced" friend (Kelly Preston) shows her the ropes.
link.title: synopsis
I Don't Know How She Does It

link.synopsis: Beverly Boyer (Doris Day) is a happily married housewife whose life changes dramatically when the president of a soap company decides she's the perfect TV pitchwoman for his product. After the ads air, Beverly becomes famous and a better breadwinner than her doctor husband (James Garner) -- who doesn't cope well with the change! The Boyers scramble to patch up their crumbling marriage in this classic 1960s comedy.
link.title: synopsis
By the Light of the Silvery Moon
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: Napoleon Dynamite's Jon Heder stars as a pretentious goldbricker living with his doting mother (Diane Keaton) who floats through life pretending that his existence has meaning in this rib-tickling comedy from director Tim Hamilton. But when Mom falls in love and wants to tie the knot with a charming motivational speaker, her pseudo-brainiac son realizes that he may be losing his hold on the comfortable life he's fashioned for himself.
link.title: synopsis
Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
